result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Kneesel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan M Kneesel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan M Kneesel was found guilty of Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
First 4 months to be served without release and remainder of sentence to be served on House Arrest pursuant to the standards of Justice Support Services

Sentence Credit of 49 days to be applied to the confinement portion of the sentence and any "good time" credit is to be applied proportionately 

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM - Def in court.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF: I was expelled from OWI court and serving a sentence and served the confinement portion and was now on EM. CRT: you will have to serve 3 more days to make up for the violations.  Credit is denied for  4/6, 12,20 and termination date is extended by 3 days. 
ejss
Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed. SLH set for hearing this week.
for Sentence Modification - Release to JSS EM - Denied SLH - he is being released by the end of the month.

for Sentence Modification  to serve sentence on EM
PER SLH:  Denied

for Sentence Modification  to be released to EM on 3-14-16 instead of 3-21-16
PER SLH:  Denied
Judgment - no fwd address
Revoked- sentenced to CJ
Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to Civil Judgment - signed by SLH
from PO Pierzina   re: Sentencing after Revocation

3:30 PM - Def in court w/Atty Keith Belzer.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BELZER: I didn't get the report until after 1:30 today. We just talked about it. DEF: i wish to proceed today, now. KELLIS: this deal ensured no felony on his record and the chance for him to get trmt f/ sub abuse issues. The crt is aware of his inability to compat his sub abuse issues, despite all those breaks, there wasn't much of an effort at all. No completed AODA program. Violations were an extension of what he had while on bond. Tested + for Rx drugs, missed tests frequently.  Everything we intended to happen - didn't. Given the read ins and what was alleged I venture to guess nothing has changed. When he's released on less supervision than he had while on probation and in OWI court, there's real possibility to see him for the same behavior. Asking for the max penalty w/ credit for 44 days. CRT: i did take notice of the OWI expulsing ltr and EML's ltr to def. STEVEN KNEESEL: Will take a personal interest in making sure he does the right things. BELZER: He was making an effort. He has a struggle b/f him. He has sat 40 days straight. DEF: i had a lot of time to think of what happened and what I need to do and what needs to be put into place. CRT: The OWI court record suggests you weren't trying hard. You may have had the assm't and GLMC denied completion of trmt. OWI and probation os to reduce the risk to the community. Your conduct suggests the risk at the time of sentencing exists today. I still hope for rehab but given the failure on probation it takes a back seat to protecting the community and not unduly depreciating the offense.
SENTENCE: def sentenced to 6 mos CJ - first 4 w/o release and remaining to be served on house arrest pursuant the standards of JSS w/ credit for 49 days to be applied to the confinement - good time proportionately. Unpaid financials converted to a civil judgment. 
ejss

from def   re: req to reconsider expulsion from OWI CRT
PER EML:  I will not reconsider a decision at this point - no new evidence
Letter sent to Mr. Kneesel from CRT

2:32 PM - (w/ 14TR2823-24) - Def in court w/Atty James R. Koby.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crt: put what you just put of the record in the form of an application.
Amended Information filed
Ct. 6 - neg op of MV - NO CONTEST
remaining charges and 14TR2823 are dismissed and read in
14TR2824 - 
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs 
 Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Kellis: probation w/ conditions help to address his issues. If he gets another there is no question he will be looking at prison
Koby: def believes he can benefit from OWI court. He's been candid and it's clear he's struggling w/ sub abuse. 
Def: I am sorry to put A. C. in danger w/ my driving
Crt: unusual agmt - one that's beneficial to you. I think the state is showing consideration for the fact that you have gone 10 yrs b/w 4th & this one. You could be going to prison. If there is another involving substances the liklihoold of prison is very high. 
SENTENCE:
14CF392 - Sentence withheld - 18 mos probation
Cond: participate in and complete OWI court;   No bars or taverns  Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician. No driving unless licensed in WI. Random testing.   Any other counseling or assessments as PO deems appropriate. Pay DOC fees & CC. Pay $25.00 blood draw costs to LCPD. 50 hrs com service. Pay DOC fees & CC

From: JSS Re: record of further testing done on his positives as well as  current prescription list
SLH: noted

11:13 AM - Def in court w/Atty James R. Koby.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JSS violations - tested + for meth and missed UA 
Koby: I haven't seen the test data so I can't respond to that one way or another. He tells me he is not a meth user. He says he was exposed to radiation. 
Def: I walked into x ray at work where they hadn't locked the doors. There was a big investigation. That's why I missed the test. I was on 2 different meds. 
Crt: JSS needs to have all your Rxs. When a test result is questioned they do screening tests and seek more specific testing and can test for the Rx and differentiate that from the illicit substances. The complaint shows a number of serious allegations. I have  3 options when I get a violation report....If any violations come in after today, unless very minor, you can expect and OTD.

11:32 PM - Def in court w/Atty James R. Koby.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OTD was issued from JS violations. He was  arrested on that and was b/f TWB and he decided to release him but set for RH today. 
Koby: I sent his med recs to Sackmaster.
Keller: the records that were provided yesterday didn't show any Rx being filled that would account for opiates. 
Crt: you are on bond w/ conditions. It's irresponsible for me to allow you to be in a situation where you can use that aren't RX'd and endangering the public b/c of that.  I can't imagine why you won't respond to JS request for a list of Rx's. Next time you violate you will sit in jail a lot longer
HEARING: 11/5 @ 2:30 - JS to indicate if the Rx's provided would account for the positive tests

appeared in court

1:30 PM  - Def in court w/Atty James R. Koby.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Koby: it's a bond hearing b/c I got a verbal notification of a JSS violation and since I set the hearing I have asked for documentation from them. I just got it b/f court. I checked to see what was goin on. He's in treatment at Gundersen. There was no male present when he did his sample.
Keller: no objection to lifting the OTD.
Koby: we are waiting for a trans from Tremp county to pin down the level of offense and it will make negotiations run more smoothly. 
Crt: sig bond to con't. You have serious charges and testing is a fundamental condition of the bond and I won't stand by and watch con't use and make it more likely you will endanger the public. It's irresponsible on my part to do so. Missed test = pos test. Quash OTD (hjm)
